info.name: [Blueprint] Intergalactic Bank API Reference Documentation Collection
info.description: The Intergalactic Bank API makes it easy to manage transaction and account data. Whether you‚Äôre running an ATM for Astronauts or simply interested in keeping tabs on your Cosmic Coins, Intergalactic Bank has you covered with the REST-based requests to make it happen. This collection serves as a reference for all of the requests available in this API. For ideas on how to use these different requests to accomplish common banking tasks, we recommend checking out our workflows collection (also available as a Postman Collection Template). ## ü™ê **Getting Started** Here's a summary of what you need to know to get started with the Intergalactic Bank API: - You must use a valid API Key to send requests to the API endpoints. For this API, everyone will use the API Key `1234`. You can see this value pre-filled in the Collection Variables tab, and the Collection-level authorization tab. - Some endpoints are for Admin Users only. These are noted in the request's documentation. - The API has rate and usage limits. - The API returns request responses in JSON format. When an API request returns an error, it is sent in the JSON response as an error key. For more details, check out the additional sections below. ## üîê Authentication - The Intergalactic Bank API uses an **API Key** for authentication. - You must include an API key in each request to the Postman API with the `x-api-key` request header. - The API key has been pre-filled as a [collection variable](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/). The authentication has been set up at the collection level, so all requests in this collection will automatically inherit the needed header. ### Authentication error response - If an API key is missing, malformed, or invalid, you will receive an HTTP `401 Unauthorized` response code. - If you don't have permission to perform the operation, you will receive an HTTP `403 Forbidden` response. ## Rate and usage limits API access rate limits apply at a per-API key basis in unit time. The limit is 300 requests per minute. Also, depending on your plan, you may have usage limits. If you exceed either limit, your request will return an HTTP 429 Too Many Requests status code. Each API response returns the following set of headers to help you identify your use status: | Header | Description | | --- | --- | | `X-RateLimit-Limit` | The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per minute. | | `X-RateLimit-Remaining` | The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window. | | `X-RateLimit-Reset` | The time at which the current rate limit window resets in UTC epoch seconds. | ## ‚úçÔ∏è Responses & Examples Though we always aim to return the data you seek, often, errors are inevitable. We have documented many of the possible responses you might encounter using [Examples](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/examples/) under each request. ### ü§î **Need some help?** In case you have questions, check out our tutorials: - [Video: Get and Set Variables](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EKv6n-jY9lU&list=PLM-7VG-sgbtC5tNXxd28cmePSa9BYwqeU&index=65) - [Request Authorization in Postman](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/authorization/) - FAQ Page Additionally, you can check out our [community forum](https://community.postman.com) to review topics, ask questions, and learn from others.

exec: pm.test(`${testLocation} - Should return a object`, function () {
pm.expect(response, 'The response is not an object').to.be.an('object');
pm.test(`${testLocation} - Should contain the 'apiKey' property in the response`, function () {
pm.expect(response, 'The response does not contain the property').to.haveOwnProperty('apiKey');
pm.test(`${testLocation} - Should return a string for the 'apiKey' property`, function () {
pm.expect(response.apiKey, 'The property is not a string').to.be.a('string');

request.description: This request generates a new API key and saves it to the collection variables if the request is successful.

item.name: Accounts

query.description: (Optional) The full name of the account owner
(Optional) The date the account was created in `YYYY-MM-DD` format

request.description:
List all accounts that exist at the the Intergalactic Bank. Optionally, filter by `owner` (using a full name), or the `createdAt` date (using `YYYY-MM-DD` format).

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will return an `accounts` object that contains an array of nested accounts matching the search criteria.

If no accounts are found to match the search criteria, the `accounts` object will contain an empty array.

Get information about an account by passing the `accountId` as a path parameter.

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will contain an `account` object matching the search criteria.

If no account with that ID is found, the request will return a `404 Not Found` error.

Creates a new account at the Intergalactic Bank.

### Request Body Properties

| Property Name | Property Type | **Description** | **Required?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| owner | String | Full name of the person opening this account | Yes |
| balance | Number | The starting balance of the account. If omitted, the balance will default to 0. | No |
| currency | String - Possible values: `COSMIC_COINS`, `GALAXY_GOLD`, `MOON_BUCKS` | The currency this account will be using for transactions. This cannot be changed once established. | Yes |

### Response

A successful request will contain a single `account` object with the newly created `transactionId`

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account to update

request.description:
Update information about an account by passing the `accountId` as a path parameter and additional information through the Request Body.

### Request Body Properties

| **Property Name** | **Data Type** | **Description** | **Required?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| owner | String | Full Name | Yes |

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will contain an `account` object matching the search criteria.

If no account with that ID is found, the request will return a `404 Not Found` error.

If the requesting party does not have Admin permissions, the request will return a `403 Forbidden` Error.

### Important!

Only Bank Admins have permission to update an account. You may encounter a `403 Forbidden Error` if you try to update an account without the correct permissions.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account to update
(Required) The ID of the account to update

response.name: Forbidden

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account to update

exec: pm.test(`${testLocation} - Should return the correct response on account deletion`, function () {

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account to delete

request.description:
Delete an account by passing in the `accountId` as a path parameter.

### Response

A successful request will return an empty response.

If no account with that ID is found, the request will return a `404 Not Found` error.

If the requesting party does not have Admin permissions, the request will return a `403 Forbidden` Error.

### Important!

Once an account is deleted, it cannot be restored, so please use this endpoint with caution.

Additionally, only Bank Admins have permission to update an account. You may encounter a `403 Forbidden` Error if you try to update an account without the correct permissions.

response.name: Forbidden

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account to delete

item.description: An Account at the Intergalactic Bank allows you to store funds. Use the _**account**_ endpoints contained in this folder to... - List accounts \- get all accounts that meet your search criteria. - Get a single account - If you are looking to retrieve information about a specific account, provide an `accountId` and receive information about the account. - Create a new account - Create a new account - Update an account - Update account information (admin only) - Delete an Account - Delete an account (admin only) Account endpoints do not return information about transactions. To retrieve transaction information, check out the requests in the **Transactions** folder.

item.name: Transactions

query.description: (Optional) The date of the transaction in`YYYY-MM-DD` format
(Optional) The ID of the account receiving the transaction
(Optional) The ID of the account where transactions originate from

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves transactions for a given account, optionally filtering on the date created (`createdAt`) and the account receiving the transaction (`toAccountId`).

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will contain an array of transaction objects matching the search criteria.

If no matching transactions are found, the transactions object will contain an empty array.

query.description: (Optional) The date of the transaction in ISO 8601 format. Ex: `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`
(Optional) The ID of the account receiving the transaction

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account where transactions originate from

query.description: (Optional) The date of the transaction in ISO 8601 format. Ex: `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`
(Optional) The ID of the account receiving the transaction

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the account where transactions originate from
(Required) ID of the transaction to retrieve

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves details of a specific transaction by providing the transaction ID as a path parameter.

If you are looking to retrieve more than one transaction, check out the **List Transactions** request.

### Response

Upon a successful request, the response will contain a single transaction object matching the search criteria.

If no transaction with the given ID is found, the request will return a `404 Not Found` error.

Creates a new transaction. There are two types of transactions that can be performed using this endpoint:

- Transfer funds between accounts by providing two account IDs in the `fromAccountID` and `toAccountID` fields.
- Add money to an account by using `"0"` as the value for `fromAccountID`.
    

### Response

A successful request will contain a single transaction object with the newly created `transactionId`

If there are not enough funds in the originator's account to complete the transaction, the request will return a `403 Insufficient Funds` error.

### Important!

Transactions cannot be edited once created, so use this endpoint with caution.

response.name: 403 Insufficient funds

item.description: A _**transaction**_ records money moving in or out of an account. Transactions at the Galactic Bank follow a blockchain-like approach. Once created, they cannot be updated or deleted. Use the **transaction** endpoints contained in this folder to... - List transactions \- get all transactions from an account, with options to filter by date, or the account they were delivered to. - Get a single transaction - If you are looking to retrieve information about a specific transaction, provide a `transactionId` and receive information about the transaction. - Create a new transaction - create a new transfer or deposit transaction for a given account. Transactions do not contain any information about the account balance. To inquire about account balances and other account-related details, please refer to the requests in the **Accounts** folder.
